channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023080075
item.description:
Report E-2023080075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2924 "M2488" release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and a tote transfer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12-ounces of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. Crew began by neutralizing the released product with a soda ash solution and using spill pads to collect all free-standing liquid. The product was then transferred into a new tote for shipment on. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with the spill pads and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: ENGLEWOOD

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the hazmat while loading it to a van, and it started to leak. It was quickly turned right side up to stop the leakage. DescribePack: It is leaking at the lid of the metal bucket DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Soak pads and fluff were put on the floor to soak up any spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023080285
item.description:
Report X-2023080285

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking in the load side. Package was then segregated into a damage tote with a liner and brought to QA. Upon inspection, contents were found with loosed caps. DescribePack: Caps were loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with bag liner observing orientation arrows.
